story.storykicker: Many distributors are battling for the rights of the much-anticipated film, and reportedly the Karnataka theatrical rights of Kabali was bought for a record price by a distributor.
story.storybody:
Kabali has not yet hit the theatres but the film has already done business for Rs 200 crore through the satellite rights and distribution rights according to film trade analyst Sreedhar Pillai.

ALSO READ: Kabali - The album of Rajinikanth's film will be launched on June 11

Many distributors are battling for the rights of the much-anticipated film, and reportedly the Karnataka theatrical rights of Kabali was bought for a record price by a distributor. With these developments, Kabali has earned more than Rs 200 crore even before its theatrical release.

The film will hit about 5000 screens across the world on July 1. The makers are simultaneously releasing the film in Tamil, Telugu, Hindi and Malayalam.

The makers have also dubbed the film in Malay to cash in the craze for Rajinikanth in the Island country. Kabali is now the first Indian film to be dubbed in the Malay language.

The audio launch of the film is scheduled on June 11 in Chennai. It will be held in a grand manner in the popular YMCA ground according to sources.

story.shortheadline: Kabali has raked in Rs 200 cr even before its release (this is not a Rajinikanth joke)
